> I was wondering if anyone else here had thought much
> about this subject or given a shot at implementing
> them.

I'm not sure if I've mentioned this yet, but one of the things I'd like to
see is a system that evolves the nn developmental system rules along with
the actual entities. Sort of like an coevolutionary embodiment thing. The
way I see it, it could be set up as a simple kind of coevolution: one
population of entities (DNA strings) and a population of developmental
rule sets. This is along the lines of some of DeJong's and also Ficici's
work over at Brandeis (coevolving teacher/learner pairs).

I think this could be really powerful, because it can incorporate the
minimal starting and incremental complexification ideas (on a higher
level) with a developmental system that can explore the targeting and
heterochrony that leads to the various forms of reuse.

This dichotomy is really important in biology, i.e., DNA is almost
completely useless information without the developmental system that it is
paired with. And the two definately evolved together.

Personally, I'd love to do a PhD thesis on this idea if I can get into a
good graduate school.

-- 

Joseph Reisinger
